p: The composition of EOs from a particular species of plant can differ depending on harvesting seasons, genetics, agricultural practices, and geographical sources [ 59, 60, 61]. Such variation led to the formation of chemically different molecules, but with similarities. For example, in Greek oregano plants, the sum of cymene, Î³-terpinene, carvacrol, and thymol is similar in EO derived from different geographic origins [ 62]. Also, it remains stable whatever the season of plant harvesting [ 63, 64]. This indicates that the four listed compounds are biologically and functionally associated.
